title: A rare Star Wars Boba Fett figurine is expected to set record with up to $500million at auction
text:
The Boba Fett plastic toy, one of most sought after collectibles in the Star Wars galaxy, is on the auction block and it could go for a record-setting $500,000.

One of the legendary figurines is headed to auction in Pennsylvania and will likely shatter the the record for Star Wars memorabilia.

Bidding for the 3.7-inch tall Boba Fett was already topping $120,000, eclipsing the previous high of $112,926 for any auctioned-off Star Wars toy, the New York Post said.

What makes the figurine so rare less than 100 models were ever made and quickly yanked from the shelved after its missile-firing backpack was considered a choking hazard to kids.

One Star Wars collector can make history, buying the elusive prototype Boba Fett figurine. It's expected to fetch up $500,000 at auction

The rare Boba Fett figurine that was pulled before hitting the shelves in 1979 is now on the auction block

The 3.7-inch tall version of the Boba Fett is expected to make a record in auction next month. Here the character appears in 1983's Return of the Jedi

Among the items up for bid at Hake's Auctions is a 'Holy Grail of Star Wars collecting,' a Boba Fett prototype figurine by Kenner

Today, there are believed to be less than 30 items in existence.

'It is the Holy Grail of Star Wars collecting,' Kelly McClain, a spokesman for the auction house, told The Post. 'It's extremely unique.'

The prototype product was available by mail-in offers as a tie-in to the 1980 release of The Empire Strikes Back, the first Star Wars sequel.

In the movie, the bounty hunter character is hired by Darth Vader to capture Han Solo. Boba Fett first appeared as an animated character on TV in 1978.

Bidding for the Boba Fett closes on November 7.
description: The Boba Fett 1979 prototype figurine could sell in auction for a record $500,000. Only about 100 items were produced and never sold because of a choking hazard.
